ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I really, really improved my scientific research and writing skills.
I became much more fluent in writing about/in the field of psychology!
Learned some statistical analysis in SPSS, research methods in psychology studies, and how to design and execute my own survey-based study
I learned how to read and write psychological papers, and understand how to interpret data from research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: great, great feedback (especially at the beginning of the semester)
Weakness: not major, but grades were turned in quite late and feedback became quite sporadic at the end of the semester

I think that the course assignments are really well-structured, and though the course is fast-paced, it really helps you learn to get work done incrementally. The only weakness is that because there were so many assignments for instructors to grade, we often did not get them back in time to help inform the assignments that built off of those.

There's honestly a lot of work for this course--textbook readings and quizzes, in-class activities, and two research papers you have to write. I understand that it is a writing-intensive class, so perhaps the Inquisitive quizzes could be done away with. I didn't really feel like I was taking much away from the quizzes that I couldn't learn from the readings or lectures. The quizzes felt like busy work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it really helps with improving one's scientific research and writing skills.

I would! I think that the writing intensive option is worth it, especially if you need a writing credit, as it's not a lot of work and I found that my confidence in my writing (and how fast I was able to produce writing) increased noticeably through this course. Also, Professor Duchscherer is great and makes the work very doable!
Yes, you really sharpen your scientific writing skills in this class.
